questions.question: What is the primary function of an Invitation Card?
options: To request the presence of someone at an event
questions.explanation: Invitation cards are formal requests inviting guests to attend specific events like weddings, parties, or ceremonies.

questions.question: Which MS Word feature is best for placing text in specific areas of an invitation card, independent of margins?
questions.explanation: Text Boxes act as floating containers, allowing you to drag and position text anywhere on the page layout.

questions.question: In the context of MS Word, what is a 'Template'?
options: A temporary file that deletes itself
A pre-designed document format that can be used as a starting point
questions.explanation: Templates provide a pre-set structure and design (e.g., for notes or resumes) so you don't have to start from blank.

questions.question: When designing a formal invitation, which tab allows you to add a decorative border around the page?
questions.explanation: The Page Borders command, found in the Design tab, lets you apply artistic borders to the entire page.

questions.question: Which of the following is a key benefit of 'Digital Note-Taking' over traditional paper notes?
options: Digital notes can be searched instantly using keywords
questions.explanation: Searchability is a major advantage; you can find specific terms in digital notes instantly, unlike paper notebooks.

questions.question: To organize notes hierarchically (Main points vs. Sub-points), which tool should you use?
questions.explanation: Multilevel lists allow you to indent items to show sub-points under main points, creating a clear hierarchy.

questions.question: Which paper size is commonly used for smaller invitation cards (half the size of standard A4)?
questions.explanation: A5 (148 x 210 mm) is half the size of A4 and is a very popular standard size for invitations and flyers.

questions.question: How do you access online templates in Microsoft Word?
options: Go to File > New and search in the search bar
questions.explanation: The 'New' screen in the File tab allows you to search for thousands of online templates provided by Microsoft.

questions.question: Which alignment is most traditional for the text on a formal invitation card?
questions.explanation: Center alignment is the standard for formal invitations as it presents the information symmetrically and elegantly.

questions.question: Which digital skill involves saving your notes to a service like OneDrive or Google Drive?
questions.explanation: Cloud storage allows your notes to be saved online, making them accessible from any device (phone, laptop, tablet).

questions.question: If you want to print 4 small invitations on a single sheet of A4 paper, which print setting should you adjust?
questions.explanation: The 'Pages per sheet' option in Print settings allows you to scale down and print multiple document pages on one physical sheet.

questions.question: What is the purpose of adding 'Alt Text' to images in your digital notes?
options: To improve accessibility for screen readers (describing the image)
To make the image black and white
questions.explanation: Alt Text (Alternative Text) provides a text description of images for users who are visually impaired.

questions.question: Which tool would you use to change the background color of your invitation card?
questions.explanation: The Page Color option in the Design tab fills the entire background of the document with a selected color.

questions.question: When taking notes during a lecture, which view in Word helps you focus by removing toolbars?
questions.explanation: Focus Mode (often found in the View tab or status bar) hides the ribbon and other interface elements to minimize distractions.

questions.question: What essential information is missing from this invitation: 'Come to my party on Saturday'?
questions.explanation: An invitation must include the 'Who, What, When, and Where'. Missing time and location makes it useless.

questions.question: Which font type is often avoided in formal documents because it is considered too casual?
questions.explanation: Comic Sans is a casual, handwriting-style font that is generally considered unprofessional for formal invitations or business notes.

questions.question: [Digital Skill] How can AI tools assist in note-taking?
options: By summarizing long texts and generating key points automatically
questions.explanation: AI tools (like Copilot or generic AI assistants) can process long notes and generate concise summaries or action items.

questions.question: To ensure your invitation card looks good when printed, you should use high-resolution images. What does 'Resolution' refer to?
options: The quality and sharpness of the image (dots per inch)
questions.explanation: Resolution (DPI/PPI) determines how sharp and clear an image looks; low resolution results in pixelated/blurry prints.

questions.question: Which shortcut creates a new blank document (or opens the New pane) in most Office apps?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + N is the standard shortcut to create a New document.

questions.question: If you want to move an image freely around your invitation text, you must change its:
options: Wrap Text setting (e.g., to 'In Front of Text')
questions.explanation: By default, images are inline with text. Changing Text Wrap to 'In Front of Text' or 'Square' unlocks free movement.
